div.sent: We live in a family.
The family consists of parents and the children.
Each member of the family has some work to do.
Keeping the house neat and clean;
Growing fruit trees and flowers in the vacant space around the house;
Looking after them; Tending the domestic animals and birds, etc.
All this is family development work.
Likewise, there is development work in the school.
We use them and we will take good care of them.
We will make sure that these articles are not damaged.
We will not write anything on the inside or the outside of the classroom walls.
We will not cut any marks on them.
We will keep the school neat and clean.
We will take down the following table in our notebooks.
We will take part in the development work in the school.
This development work will include growing flowers and vegetables in the empty space.
We will fence them in order to protect them.
We will water the plants and put fertilizers around the stems.
We will never keep the premises dirty.
We will develop a library in the school.
We will donate books to the best of our ability.
We will collect books for the library.
In oar spare time we will read books.
This is how we will increase our knowledge of the outside world beyond our textbooks.
We will become enlightened.
We will read books of the library and put them in the right place.
We will never tear the books, mark the pages and fold them.
We will not speak unnecessarily in the library.
We will maintain silence.
We take down in our notebooks the following table of development work in the school.
We will take part in the development in our school through various organizations.
Of these organizations, the most remarkable are Scouting and Girls Guide.
The first stage of Scouting is called cubing.
Cubing is formed with boys aged between six and eleven.
A group of 24 cubs form a group.
In each school one or two groups may be formed.
Each week a meeting is held for training of the cubs.
A group of Yellow Birds is formed with girls aged between six and ten.
Their training is generally given through games.
The maximum number of girls in this group is Their motto is to help1.
We will also form Cubs and Groups of Yellow Birds in our school.
Thus we will develop our society and country.
